definition: to chase after/to seek/to do one's utmost to seek or procure sth/to recall
race/nationality/ethnicity/clan/by extension, social group (e.g. office workers 上班族)

sentences.english: You really are starstruck aren't you?
sentences.chinese: 你真的是一個追星族，是嗎？

sentences.english: Many star-chasers leeched onto the pop singer.
sentences.chinese: 許多追星族死纏那位紅歌星，表示愛慕之情。

sentences.english: How do fans choose their favourite MTV stars?
sentences.chinese: 追星族怎樣選擇他們最喜歡的音樂電視明星？

sentences.english: We spent way too much time being the biggest thing for teenyboppers.
sentences.chinese: 我們花了太多時間做追星族的“大明星”。

sentences.english: Fans lined up for the signature from the super star.
sentences.chinese: 追星族排隊等候大明星的簽名。

sentences.english: Star-chasing teenage girls usually like fashion shows.
sentences.chinese: 追星族的少女一般都喜歡時裝表演。

sentences.english: Groupies always get first hand information.
sentences.chinese: 追星族總是有偶像的第一手資料。

definition: angry youth/positive term used to describe young Chinese with extreme nationalistic tendencies/see also 糞青|粪青[fen4 qing1]
to be smitten with sb/love-struck fool/starry-eyed infatuation
a guy who stays at home all the time, typically spending a lot of time playing online games (derived from Japanese "otaku")
new generation of youths (generation X, Y etc)
